ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: the All-Merciful, established firmly upon the Throne.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: The ever-merciful, established on the throne (of authority).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: The Most Compassionate Lord is settled on the Throne (of the Universe).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: The Beneficent God is dominant over the Throne (of the realm).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: The Most Gracious Who, befitting His Majesty, took to the Throne (of control).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: The Most Gracious Istawa the Throne.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: The Beneficent Allah is firm in power.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: the All-compassionate sat Himself upon the Throne; to Him belongs
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: The Beneficent One, Who is established on the Throne.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: the All Merciful settled on the throne.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: The Compassionate on the Throne is established.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: (Allah) Most Gracious is firmly established on the throne (of authority).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: The Most Beneficent (Allah) Istawa (rose over) the (Mighty) Throne (in a manner that suits His Majesty).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: the Merciful willed to the Throne.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: The Most Merciful; on the Throne He settled.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: The Most Merciful [who is] above the Throne established.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [20:5] He is, the Compassionate One presided upon the Throne (al-‘arsh, in the [classical Arabic] language denotes a king’s seat) a presiding befitting of Him;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (The Beneficent One, Who is established on the Throne) it is also said that this means: He filled it; and it is also said that this is a mystery that cannot be explained.
